etymologies: late 18th century (in an earlier sense). From German Uranit from Uranus (then newly discovered) + -it. Compare French uranite

definitions: Any of various minerals or ores containing uranium; (in later use) specifically any of a group of minerals which are phosphates and arsenates of uranium (in the form of the cation uranyl) and another metal.

notes.text: The commonest forms are distinguished as autunite (containing calcium) and torbernite (containing copper).
